Package service

Class ArrayTree

java.lang.Object
service.ArrayTree
public class ArrayTree extends Object
This class has the implementation of the Array based AVL tree. Constructor takes size of the tree and the type of the ITreeNode whose type the array must be.

    • SearchNode

      public Integer SearchNode(Integer id, Integer startIndex)
      this method is used to search for a node in the tree using the nodeId as the element. Algorithm :
      Search starts from the first index i.e. root of the tree and then depending on the node's id and the search key the search is shifted on either left or right child of the root and this procedure continues till the search key is found. If element is found array index is returned else -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      id -
      startIndex -
      Returns:

    • CreateBST

      public void CreateBST(Integer index, Integer start, Integer end, List<ITreeNode> sortedTree)
      This is the method which creates AVL tree in form of an array. it takes ordered list of nodes by nodeId as the input and performs the operations to convert that sorted array into AVL tree. Algorithm :
      1. Mid of the sorted array is taken and added as the 1st index of our ArrayTree
      2. All the elements from start to mid-1 are taken and same create BST method is called
      3. All the elements from mid+1 to start are taken and same create BST is called
      4. This process repeats till all the elements are taken into the tree
      Resultant array will be of the form
      parent = i ; leftChild = 2*i + 1; rightChild = 2*i+2
      Parameters:
      index -
      start -
      end -
      sortedTree -
